name: Cabinet (Cabinet des Médailles)
description: Cabinet (Cabinet des Médailles); Attributed to André-Charles Boulle (French, 1642 - 1732, master before 1666); Paris, France; about 1710 - 1715; Oak and fir veneered with ebony, amaranth, kingwood, brass, and tortoise shell, gilt-bronze mounts; sarrancolin des Pyrénées marble top; 82.6 x 140.3 x 72.4 cm (32 1/2 x 55 1/4 x 28 1/2 in.); 84.DA.58; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Cabinet (Cabinet des Médailles)
medium: Oak and fir veneered with ebony, amaranth, kingwood, brass, and tortoise shell, gilt-bronze mounts; sarrancolin des Pyrénées marble top
